name: twist to the classic beanie
notes:
**pattern description**
the twist to the classic beanie uses simple stitches with intervals of increases and decreases to give is a nice wavy effect.

to add to that, the pattern is mostly worked in back loop only which adds a lovely ridged texture to it. this crochet beanie pattern is simple but unique and works up fast. furthermore, it's easy to customize in terms of size, fit and colour.

**skill level:** beginner

**size options:**
the free pattern is offered in one size that fits most teens and adults. with the pdf, you get 7 additional sizes that range from newborn all the way to large adult.

**materials needed:**
•	5 mm crochet hook
•	#4 worsted weight yarn
•	pompom (optional)
•	darning needle
•	scissors

**yarn details:**
this pattern uses approximately 230 yards of #4 worsted weight yarn. this pattern is a good match for solid color to bring out the textured stitches to their best advantage. however, if you want to use variegated yarn, i recommend complementing it with a solid colour for better stitch definition.
